intro: Rheedia achachairu, commonly known as the Andean starleaf, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to the cool, humid climates of its native habitat. Rheedia achachairu produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, adding a unique ornamental value to its appearance. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
